summary: This is an email exchange between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and Assistant United States Attorney Jeff Pagliuca regarding scheduling a trial date for the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case. The defense references a previous position letter and proposes November 8, 2021, for the trial.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with the prosecution to schedule a trial date.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense counsel about trial scheduling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which trial scheduling is being discussed.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case.
Professional correspondence between defense and prosecution regarding trial scheduling.
Pagliuca is the prosecutor in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Position Letter
events.description: The defense sent a letter detailing their position, referenced in Sternheim's email.

events.title: Proposed Trial Date
events.description: Defense proposes November 8, 2021, as a potential start date for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email is correspondence between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling her criminal trial.
The defense proposed November 8, 2021, as a potential trial start date.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, docket number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The prosecution had requested availability for trial dates from September 2021 through the end of the year.
The defense references a previous position letter dated April 22, 2021.
